channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- Ryzen™ 2000 series Desktop Processors “Raven Ridge” AM4
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- Ryzen™ 2000 series Desktop Processors “Raven Ridge” AM4

item.title: CVE-2021-26365|2024-08-03T20:26:25.153Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Certain size values in firmware binary headers could trigger out of bounds reads during signature validation, leading to denial of service or potentially limited leakage of information about out-of-bounds memory contents.

item.title: CVE-2021-26354|2024-08-03T20:26:25.140Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in ASP may allow an attacker to issue a system call from a compromised ABL which may cause arbitrary memory values to be initialized to zero, potentially leading to a loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-26406|2024-08-03T20:26:25.475Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient validation in parsing Owner's Certificate Authority (OCA) certificates in SEV (AMD Secure Encrypted Virtualization) and SEV-ES user application can lead to a host crash potentially resulting in denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-26371|2024-08-03T20:26:25.196Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: A compromised or malicious ABL or UApp could send a SHA256 system call to the bootloader, which may result in exposure of ASP memory to userspace, potentially leading to information disclosure.
